comments: Each test consists of a set of parameters, starting conditions, and a
series of block heights and timestamps relative to those starting
conditions along with the expected resulting difficulty bits for them.
The params field for each test references the keys in the params object.
The powLimit field is a hex-encoded unsigned 256-bit integer.
The powLimitBits, startDiffBits, and expectedDiffBits fields are unsigned 32-bit integers.
The targetSecsPerBlock, halfLifeSecs, startHeight, and startTime fields are signed 64-bit integers.
The height field is an unsigned 64-bit integer.
halfLifeSecs is the ùúè (tau) parameter for the equations in the specification.

scenarios.description: mainnet: steady 300s blocks at proof of work limit
mainnet: steady 300s blocks at hardest difficulty
mainnet: half life blocks from hardest to easiest difficulty
mainnet: 0s height-based half life blocks from easiest to hardest difficulty
mainnet: random solve times per Poisson distribution for a stable hashrate
mainnet: random solve times per Poisson distribution for an increasing hashrate (average 15s)
mainnet: random solve times per Poisson distribution for a decreasing hashrate (average 1000s)
mainnet: 300s blocks across signed 32-bit int height
mainnet: 300s blocks across max 64-bit signed int height and 32-bit max signed int time
mainnet: blocks across potential internal calculation overflow boundaries

tests.notes: needs 64 bits in inner frac add

scenarios.description: mainnet: blocks that exercise max fractional part in internal calculation
testnet: steady 120s blocks at proof of work limit
testnet: random solve times per Poisson distribution for a stable hashrate
simnet: steady 1s blocks at proof of work limit
simnet: random solve times per Poisson distribution for a stable hashrate
